title: Middle East & Africa Pharmaceuticals Market, By Country, Competition, Forecast and Opportunities, 2020-2030F
summary: The Middle East & Africa Pharmaceuticals Market was valued at USD 30.07 Billion in 2024, and is expected to reach USD 42.42 Billion by 2030, rising at a CAGR of 6.10%. The market is primarily driven by the region's growing population, increasing prevalence of chronic diseases, and rising healthcare expenditure.
content: The Middle East & Africa Pharmaceuticals Market is primarily driven by several factors including the region's growing population, increasing prevalence of chronic diseases, and rising healthcare expenditure. As the population continues to expand, there is a higher demand for pharmaceutical products to meet healthcare needs.

Cardiovascular disease (CVD) has emerged as the leading cause of death in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA), responsible for over a third of all fatalities, with more than 1.4 million deaths annually. In Africa, chronic diseases account for over 15 million deaths annually between the ages of 30 and 69.

According to an Alpen Capital report, the region is home to over 742 hospitals with more than 106,693 beds, with an estimated 161 healthcare projects in the GCC alone, valued at approximately USD 53.2 billion. Healthcare spending in the UAE is projected to reach USD 26 billion by 2028.

Based on Drug Type, Generic Drugs emerged as the fastest growing segment due to their cost-effectiveness and affordability. Based on Product Type, prescription drugs emerged as the dominating segment in 2024. Saudi Arabia emerged as the dominating country in the Middle East & Africa Pharmaceuticals market in 2024.

Key market challenges include counterfeit medicines and drug quality concerns, as well as intellectual property rights and patent protection issues. The market is also benefiting from expanding access to healthcare services and growing medical tourism investments in the region.
